pull.title: scripts: remove github-merge.py
pull.body:
This script has been moved to the bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools repository,
after discussion in a core dev meeting. The rationale being that it is also useful to
other projects, and thus should be moved to a more general repository.

Meeting log: http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-08-15.html
See also: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/28

~~I'll open a follow up PR to port the documentation to the maintainer tools repo.~~
Ported the docs in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/29

events.body: Concept ACK. Also, I can't verify what script a maintainer runs anyway, can only verify the result. So imo it doesn't matter where this script lives.
You should link to the new script in the other repository, for transparency.

scripts: remove github-merge.py

This script has been moved to the bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools repository,
after discussion in a core dev meeting. The rationale being that it is also useful to
other projects, and thus should be moved to a more general repository.

Meeting log: http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-08-15.html
See also: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/28

events.message:
scripts: remove github-merge.py

This script has been moved to the bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools repository,
after discussion in a core dev meeting. The rationale being that it is also useful to
other projects, and thus should be moved to a more general repository.

Meeting log: http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-08-15.html
See also: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/28

events.body: one nit inline. Otherwise looks good.

comments.body: Let's add this documentation to the maintainer tools repo too so it doesn't get lost.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,9 @@ Repository Tools
 
 ### [Developer tools](/contrib/devtools) ###
 Specific tools for developers working on this repository.
-Contains the script `github-merge.py` for merging GitHub pull requests securely and signing them using GPG.
comments.body: Might make sense to mention the `maintainer-tools` repository (here, or somewhere else in a README), and that most developer tools live there.
I've got https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools/pull/29 open to do just that

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,9 @@ Repository Tools
 
 ### [Developer tools](/contrib/devtools) ###
 Specific tools for developers working on this repository.
-Contains the script `github-merge.py` for merging GitHub pull requests securely and signing them using GPG.
comments.body: Agree, will update with a reference to the maintainer tools repo.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,9 @@ Repository Tools
 
 ### [Developer tools](/contrib/devtools) ###
 Specific tools for developers working on this repository.
-Contains the script `github-merge.py` for merging GitHub pull requests securely and signing them using GPG.
comments.body: Updated with a link to the maintainer-tools repository.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,10 +3,10 @@ Repository Tools
 
 ### [Developer tools](/contrib/devtools) ###
 Specific tools for developers working on this repository.
-Contains the script `github-merge.py` for merging GitHub pull requests securely and signing them using GPG.
+Additional tools, including the `github-merge.py` script, are available in the [maintainer-tools](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-maintainer-tools) repository.
 
 ### [Verify-Commits](/contrib/verify-commits) ###
-Tool to verify that every merge commit was signed by a developer using the above `github-merge.py` script.
+Tool to verify that every merge commit was signed by a developer using the `github-merge.py` script.
comments.body: nit: s/signed by a developer/signed by a maintainer/
